[File: aptos-core/crates/fallible/src/copy_from_slice.rs] [Function: copy_slice_to_vec()] [Alignment requirements] Can types T with strict alignment requirements (e.g., u128, SIMD types) cause copy_from_slice to perform unaligned access, resulting in hardware exceptions on some validator architectures? [File: aptos-core/crates/fallible/src/copy_from_slice.rs] [Function: copy_slice_to_vec()] [Struct padding] For composite types T, does copy_from_slice handle padding bytes consistently, or could different compiler versions produce different padding layouts causing consensus divergence? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/fallible/src/copy_from_slice.rs] [Function: copy_slice_to_vec()] [SIMD optimization] If Rust's std library uses SIMD instructions for copy_from_slice on certain platforms, could this cause different behavior between validators with and without SIMD support? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/fallible/src/copy_from_slice.rs] [Function: copy_slice_to_vec()] [LLVM backend] Could differences in LLVM optimization passes across Rust compiler versions cause copy_from_slice to generate different code, affecting validator determinism? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/fallible/src/copy_from_slice.rs] [Function: copy_slice_to_vec()] [Incorrect usage] Can callers pass slice and vec that appear to have matching lengths but point to overlapping memory regions through unsafe code, violating the function's preconditions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/fallible/src/copy_from_slice.rs] [Function: copy_slice_to_vec()] [Error handling bypass] Can callers ignore or incorrectly handle CopySliceError in non-critical paths, causing silent failures that accumulate into consensus divergence over time? (Medium)
